page.title: 05Conservation in Monks Kirby.
page.content: A small pond was dug in the conservation area by a local man using a mechanical digger and although the water level did not stay up long it has proved to be an invaluable site for many types of pond life.During 1985 a larger pond was dug which has proved more successful.The pond provides just one type of habitat.Also in the area we have planted many trees and bushes and grown wild flowers to put in the area such as;corn cockle, corn marigold,poppies,may weed, purple loosestrife,and white campion.The pond has attracted many insects and frogs and provides a valuable source of food for swallows,house martins and various ducks.We have also planted some special flowers to attract butterflies and a hedge to provide yet another type of habitat.
